title: Statement on EU-US Cooperation on Turning Public Opinion Against Encryption
dot:
digraph GlobalEncryptionCoalition{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];GlobalEncryptionCoalition[label="Global Encryption Coalition
(Over 330 members in 99 countries)"]; SteeringCommittee[label="Steering Committee Members
- Center for Democracy & Technology
- Internet Society
- Global Partners Digital
- Mozilla Corp.
- Internet Freedom Foundation"]; Statement[label="Joint Statement
(April 5, 2023)"]; Concerns[label="Concerns Raised:
- Manipulation of public opinion against encryption
- Threats to privacy rights
- Law enforcement access to encrypted communications"]; Risks[label="Risks of Undermining Encryption:
- Security of private information at risk
- Malicious actors exploiting weaknesses
- Increased risk to society"]; Benefits[label="Benefits of Encryption:
- Confidentiality of information
- Used in 90% of web traffic
- Protects user data and communications
- Fundamental to modern commerce and digital society"]; LegislativeConcerns[label="Legislative Concerns:
- EU’s CSAM directive
- UK’s Online Safety Bill
- Potential dire consequences for data security"]; Recommendations[label="Recommendations:
- Governments should protect encryption
- Reject client-side scanning
- Leverage existing law enforcement powers"];GlobalEncryptionCoalition->SteeringCommittee;GlobalEncryptionCoalition->Statement;Statement->Concerns;Statement->Risks;Statement->Benefits;Statement->LegislativeConcerns;Statement->Recommendations;}
